item.title: FeatureRequest: Sending signal SIGUSR1 would act like --verbose had been chosen when started
item.description:
I was first time using xz. Wanted to make a whole 64GB (USB3) disk image, and using "xz -0" between to save efficiently empty sectors.

Started:
dd if=/dev/sdb | xz -0 --compress >/mnt/sdc1/backups/usb64G.img.xz

Now it has been running 30 minutes, and I read the xz manual page more and noticed --verbose would had been nice to give. But I do not want to break the process now and loose 30 minutes.

The output file size is now 10G, so I assume it will take about 1 hour still if 50% is roughly a compression level reached.

Would be nice, if one could send eg. SIGUSR1 to the process, and then if stderr is writable, would start to output the same information which happens if --verbose was chosen in the start.

(Yes, I know Clonezilla is a good tool to make whole disk images and so much more, but wasn't available now and didn't want to reboot.)
